titleStmt.author: Richard Nixon

div.p:
As I read of your life and works while preparing
to send a statement to this year's presentation of
the Lane Bryant Volunteer Awards, I was so struck
by your remarkable service to others that I would
like to back up my formal message with a personal
note to you on your achievements.

This is a time when every citizen is particularly
called upon to do his part in the work of human
betterment. And nothing could be more gratifying
to those who lead this country than the knowledge
that examples, such as you have set, are inspiring
and encouraging more fellow citizens to follow in
your footsteps.

I want you to know that my own admiration for you
is second to none, and that I especially value the
incentive you have provided for others and the spark
you have given to so many constructive programs.
I assure you that the knowledge of your good works
will be a continuing source of strength for me in the
duties of the Presidency, just as I hope that it may
bring you growing happiness and satisfaction in the
years ahead.

As a token of my enduring respect for you, I en-
close a special Certificate of Commendation in
tribute to your accomplishments.

body.closer:
Sincerely,
Richard Nixon
Miss Eartha M. M. White
President, Clara White Mission
Jacksonville, Florida
